snippet: Lawmakers of both parties and in both chambers of Congress are moving to introduce legislation seeking to prevent and to better prosecute abuses.
abstract: Military officials vow to assist Congress to introduce legislation aimed at preventing and better prosecuting sexual abuses in armed forces, but remain largely opposed to reversing centuries-old policy that allows commanders to decide whether and how offender should be tried.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers of both parties and in both chambers of Congress are moving to introduce legislation seeking to prevent and to better prosecute abuses.

headline.seo: Lawmakers Focus on Measures to Combat Sex Assault in Military
headline.main: Military Courts Are Called Outdated on Sex Crimes
headline.print_headline: Military Courts Are Called Outdated on Prosecutions of Sexual Assaults

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
